intro: Chondrilla uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower desert bladder, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and succulent, fleshy stems. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh environments, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. Its leaves are typically spine-tipped, reducing water loss through transpiration. Chondrilla uniflora is often found in sandy soils and is considered a pioneer species in disturbed habitats.
